sen.j: 江家次第（ごうけしだい）は、平安時代後期の有職故実書。
sen.e: "Gokeshidai" is the books on "yusoku kojitsu" (court rules of ceremony and etiquette), written in the later Heian period.
"Gokeshidai" is a collection of the books on "yusoku kojitsu" (court rules of ceremony and etiquette), written in the later Heian period.

sen.j: この時代の朝儀の集大成として評価が高い。
sen.e: It is highly valued as the compilation of various kinds of "chogi" (ceremony at Imperial Court) held in those days.

sen.j: 「江次第（ごうしだい）」と略称される場合も多く、また「江帥次第」や「江中納言次第」、「匡房卿次第」、「江抄」ともいわれる。
sen.e: It is often abbreviated to "Goshidai," and it is also called "Gosochishidai," "Gochunagonshidai," "Masafusakyoshidai," or "Gosho."

sen.j: 正確な編纂の開始時期は不明。
sen.e: It is unclear exactly when Gokeshidai began to be compiled.

sen.j: 『中外抄』などの記述によると、匡房が藤原師通の命令を受けて編纂がはじめられたという。
sen.e: Some historical sources, including "Chugaisho" (a collection of sayings of FUJIWARA no Tadazane), say that Masafusa began to compile under the order from FUJIWARA no Moromichi.

sen.j: そして、大江匡房の没した天永2年（1111年）まで書き続けられたと思われる。
sen.e: And OE no Masafusa seems to have continued writing until 1111, when he died.

sen.j: のちに加筆・増補が行われた。
sen.e: After his death, the revision and the supplement of the books was done.

sen.e: In all, the work was in 21 volumes, but Vol. 6 and Vol. 21 were lost and nonexistent today.

sen.j: 有職故実書として高い評価を得ており、これに対する注釈書として、一条兼良の『江（家）次第抄（鈔）』、尾崎積興の『江家次第秘抄』がある。
sen.e: Gokeshidai has been highly valued as the books on yusoku kojitsu, and there exist two commentaries about it, that is, "Goshidaisho" by Kaneyoshi ICHIJO and "Gokeshidai hisho" by Tsumioki OZAKI.

sen.j: 写本として、中御門宣胤書写の6冊本（天理図書館所蔵）、甘露寺親長書写の4冊本（勧修寺流旧蔵本、京都大学所蔵）がある。
sen.e: There exist several kinds of Gokeshidai's manuscript, such as that of Nobutane NAKAMIKADO's handwriting (in six volumes, owned by Tenri Library), and that of Chikanaga KANROJI's (in four volumes, formerly owned by "Kajuji-ryu" [the Kajuji line] and now owned by Kyoto University).
